document.docTitle: Metriocnemus eryngiotelmatus Donato & Paggi, 2005, n. sp.
document.masterDocTitle: A new Neotropical species of the genus Metriocnemus van der Wulp (Chironomidae: Orthocladiinae) from Eryngium L. (Apiaceae) phytotelmata

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A new Neotropical species of the genus Metriocnemus van der Wulp (Chironomidae: Orthocladiinae) from Eryngium L. (Apiaceae) phytotelmata

Etymology : The species name “
eryngiotelmatus
” refers to
Eryngium
, the host plant, and telma , from Greek, meaning pool.

Male imago ( n = 6 , except when otherwise stated) (
Figs. 2
A, C–E)

Total length 3.13–3.92 , 3.57 mm , Wing length 1.67–2.15 , 1.88 mm ; width 0.45–0.63 , 0.53 mm . Total length/wing length 1.82–1.98 , 1.89 . Wing length/length of profemur 1.93–2.08 , 1.99 . Coloration uniformly dark brown with light spots at base of setae, mainly on thorax and abdomen.

Head. AR 1–1.25 , 1.1 ( n = 5 ). Antennae with 13 flagellomeres. Ultimate flagellomere 427.1–579.6 , 503.9 . Temporal setae 34 –48, 39. Clypeus with 21 –37, 32 setae. Cibarial pump, tentorium, and stipes as in
Fig. 2
C. Tentorium 166.7–217.2 , 194.9 µm long; 30.3– 45.4 , 36.6 µm wide. Stipes 88.4–103.5 , 96.9 µm long ( n = 5 ); 30.3–63.1 , 49.5 µm wide ( n = 5 ). Palp segment lengths 42.9–50.5 , 46.7 ; 35.3–65.6 , 45.1 ; 189.4–284.7 , 229.1 ; 138.9– 213.5 , 172.7 ( n = 5 ); 194.5–244.1 , 215.1 ( n = 5 ).

Thorax (
Fig. 2
D). Antepronotum with 9 –16, 12 lateral setae. Dorsocentrals 61 –102, 81; acrostichals 46 –50, 48; prealars divided in two groups, anterior 13 –21, 16, and posterior 13 –29, 18; supraalars 2–3 . Scutellum with 12 –23, 16 fine setae, and 16 –30, 22 coarse setae. Preepisternals 5 –14, 10.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 2.
Metriocnemus eryngiotelmatus
n. sp. adults. Male: A, wing in dorsal view. C, head in dorsal view. D , thorax in lateral view. E , hypopygium left dorsal, right ventral. Female: B, wing in dorsal view. F , genitalia, ventral view. G , Gonapophysis VIII. Setae on veins are not illustrated. Scale bar = 100µm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Wing (
Fig. 2
A). VR 1.19–1.28 , 1.23 . C extension 75.7–223.7 , 158.8 µm long and with 45 –74, 58 non marginal setae. Brachiolum with 6 –9, 8 setae; R with 65 –95, 76; R 1 with 45 –67, 55; R 4 + 5 with 94–138, 122 ; RM with 3 –9, 6; M with 16 –33, 22; M 3 + 4 with 53 –70, 58; Cu with 53 –95, 78; Cu 1 with 31 –54, 37; PCu with 117–153, 139 . Wing membrane with setae covering most cells. Squama with 15 –28, 21 setae.

Legs. Spur of front tibia 78.3–101.7 , 88.5 µm long; spurs of middle tibia: 37.8–51 , 43.0 and 42.9–53 , 49.3 ( n = 4 ); of hind tibia: 40.4–48 , 44.4 and 75.7–98.5 , 86.7 µm long ( n = 5 ). Width at apex of front tibia 45.4–60.6 , 53.8 ; of middle tibia 50.5–60.6 , 55.1 ; of hind tibia 50.5–71.9 , 63.3 . Comb with 9–10 setae. Lengths (in µm) and proportions of legs in Table 1 .

Hypopygium (
Fig. 2
E). Without anal point. Setae on tergum
IX 46
–52, 48 ( n = 3 ), laterosternite IX with 5 –7, 6 setae. Phallapodeme 108.6 – 98.5 , 194.2 µm long; transverse sternapodeme 116.2 –101.0, 111.7 µm long with oral projections. Without virga. Gonocoxite 285.4 – 227.3 , 261.8 µm long; inferior volsella flat, ending at 0.59–0.66 , 0.62 . Gonostylus 143.9 – 118.7 , 129.6 µm long; crista dorsalis low, almost straight; megaseta 10.3 – 8.8 , 9.8 µm long. HR 2.15 – 1.8 , 2.01 ; HV 3.04 – 2.6 , 2.76 .

Female imago (n= 5 , except when otherwise stated) (
Figs. 2
B, F–G)

Total length 2.7–4.2 , 3.2 mm , Wing length 1.57–2.02 , 1.72 mm ; width 0.5–0.7 , 0.6 mm . Total length/wing length 1.6–2.1 , 1.8 . Wing length/length of profemur 1.85–1.95 , 1.91 . Coloration as in male.

Thorax. Antepronotum with 8 –20, 13 lateral setae. Dorsocentrals 51 –110, 80 in some specimens including 9 or 10 on humeral area; acrostichals 24 –50, 36; prealars divided in 2 groups, anterior 8 –31, 16, and posterior 14 –35, 21; supraalars 2 or 3 . Scutellum with 12 – 20, 16 fine setae, and 14 –35, 21 coarse setae.

Wing (
Fig. 2
B). VR 1.26–1.38 , 1.31 . Brachiolum with 8 –16, 11 setae. Wing membrane with setae covering most cells. Squama with 15 –22, 18 setae.

Legs. Spur of front tibia 65.6–88.4 , 75.2 long; spurs of middle tibia: 27.2–40.4 , 31.7 and 32.8–42.9 , 35.3 ; of hind tibia: 30.3–41.6 , 35.1 and 32.8–42.9 , 38.8 m long. Width at apex of front tibia 47.9– 63.1 , 54.0; of middle tibia 50.5–65.6 , 55.8 ; of hind tibia 60.6– 83.3 , 71.2 . Lengths (in µm) and proportions of legs in
Table 2
.

TABLE 1 .
Measurements (µm) and proportions of legs of male
Metriocnemus eryngiotelmatus
n. sp. Abbreviations: Femur (Fe); Tibia (Ti); Tarsomeres 1–5 (Ta 1–5 ); Leg Ratio (LR), ratio of metatarsus to tibia; “Beinverhältnisse” (BV), combined length of femur, tibia, and basitarsus divided by combined length of tarsomeres 2–5 ; “Schenkel­Scheine­verhältnis” (SV), ratio of femur plus tibia to metatarsus.
SV

Genitalia (
Fig. 2
F). Gonocoxite IX with apicomedial projection and rounded at end, with 26 –36, 32 setae ( n = 3 ). Gonapophysis VIII as shown in
Fig. 2
G. Tergite IX subrectangular with 34 –60, 50 setae ( n = 3 ). Cercus 65.6–80.8 , 73.2 µm long. Seminal capsule 68.2–88.4 , 79.3 . Notum 126.3–184.3 , 155.6 µm long.

Pupa ( n = 6 , except when otherwise stated) (
Figs. 3
F–J)
Total length 4.03– 5 , 4.35 mm . Exuviae hyaline.

Cephalothorax (
Fig.
3
I). Frontal apotome sexually dimorphic; female apex (
Fig. 3
F) more acute than male apex (
Fig. 3
G). Distance between Dc 1 and Dc 2 18.9–63.1 , 37.6 ( n = 5 ); between Dc 2 and Dc 3 12.6–27.7 , 23.04 ( n = 4 ); between Dc 3 and Dc 4 7.5–15.1 , 11.3 ( n = 4 ).

caption.paragraph:
TABLE 2. Measurements (µm) and proportions of legs of female
Metriocnemus eryngiotelmatus
n. sp. Abbreviations as in Table 1.

subSubSection.paragraph: SV

Abdomen (
Fig. 3
H). Tergites III–VIII with apical row of tubercles. Tergum III–VIII with tubercles as follows ( n = 5 ); 26 –33, 29; 25 –29, 27; 25 –29, 28; 27 –32, 29; 27 –29, 28; 17 –26, 23. Tergites III–VIII with basal band of clustered microtrichia of 3 types : simple, with 2 microtrichia usually clustered at base, and with 3 or 4 microtrichia usually clustered at base. Total number of microtrichia on Tergum III 152–182, 167 ( n = 4 ). Anal lobe angular with 2 pale setae. Anal lobe length 214.7–265.2 , 234.9 ( n = 5 ). Genital sac length 176.8–237.4 , 209.3 ( n = 4 ).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 3.
Metriocnemus eryngiotelmatus
n. sp. larva: A , mentum. B , antenna. C , mandible. D , posterior parapod claws. E , posterior parapods. Pupa: F , female frontal apotome. G , male frontal apotome. H , abdomen. I , cephalothorax. J , anal lobe. Cp = cibarial pump, Cu = cubital, M = mediana, R = radius, Sc = subcosta, St = stipes, Te = tentorium. Scale bar = 100µm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Larva ( n = 5 , except when otherwise stated) (
Figs. 3
A–E)
Total length 0.5–0.62 , 0.54 mm ( n = 3 ). Head capsule 99–120, 110 µm long. Coloration yellowish with head somewhat darker than body.

Head. Lengths of antennal segments (in µm): 20–23 , 21.2 ; 4–7 , 5.4 ; 1–3 , 2.1 ; 1–2 , 1.4 ; 0.5–1.5 , 1 . AR 0.4–0.5 , 0.46 . Basal antennal segment 8–9 , 8.8 µm wide; distance from base to ring organ 5–6 , 5.75 ( n = 4 ); to basal mark of seta 8–10 , 9.5 ; blade 9–12 , 10.3 ( n = 3 ). Setae I plumose; labral lamellae plumose. Mandible (
Fig. 3
C) 53–65 , 59.2 µm long, with 7 setae in seta interna. Mentum (
Fig. 3
A) with central teeth lower than first pair of lateral teeth. Postmentum 69–80 , 74.6 µm long.
